creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture
life_date: Japanese, active mid to late 15th century
text: Stamped with the seal “Geiai,” largely believed to be the artist name of Oguri Sōritsu, this painting depicts early winter, when the chrysanthemums are still in bloom but the surroundings are sprinkled with snow, rendered in gofun, a white pigment made from ground oyster shells.
title: Two Birds in a Snowy Tree
